content:
Hi everyone. I am currently working on a git project formalizing math with multiple people. Once in a while, after I've pulled and opened up VSCode, I am required to restart a file due to imports being out of date. Fair enough. But when I do that, my VSCode/Lean decides that it needs to re-build a large portion of mathlib. This takes very long and obviously prevents me from working. Why does this happen?
We did not change the mathlib version used in the project. Running lake exe cache get, which I'm told downloads the built mathlib files, just returns:

No files to download
Decompressing 5876 file(s)
Unpacked in 1767 ms
Completed successfully!

Is this not enough? What can I do except waiting for Lean to build the mathlib files?

Eventually, the Lean Infoview also just says "updating", with no visible progress being made.
Screenshot from 2025-03-27 18-51-39.png

This can be a sign that your local cache is borked. Among things to try are such things as running lake exe cache get!, giving the "restart server" command to the vscode lean extension, and getting the cache after completely removing the .lake file for the project.
Thanks! The get! version of the command fixed the mathlib issue. I didn't know it before.
Paul Schwahn has marked this topic as resolved.
